text:
After the battle, the veil recedes. You kneel beneath a sky of polished black stone that reflects no stars — only your face, fractured by flame. The Abyss recedes, not in defeat, but in recognition.

You are marked now. Not as victor, but as *vessel.* The flame has grown thin, stretched across too many betrayals. And yet, it clings to you. A memory rekindled. A wound reopened.

There is still one path forward — into the Silent Citadel.
lore: Legends say the obsidian sky was the mirror of the gods, now inverted by their fall. Those who kneel beneath it are judged by flame, not deed — and often found wanting.
